SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: New York Heart Association Class I
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: Without limitations of physical activity. Ordinary physical activity does not cause undue fatigue, palpitations, or dyspnea.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: New York Heart Association Class I

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: New York Heart Association Class II
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: Slight limitation of physical activity. The patient is comfortable at rest. Ordinary physical activity results in fatigue, palpitations, or dyspnea.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: New York Heart Association Class II

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: New York Heart Association Class III
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: Marked limitation of physical activity. The patient is comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary activity causes fatigue, palpitations, or dyspnea.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: New York Heart Association Class III

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: New York Heart Association Class IV
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: Inability to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Heart failure symptoms are present even at rest or with minimal exertion.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: New York Heart Association Class IV
